intro: Perymenium ecuadoricum, commonly known as the Ecuadorian perymenium, is a flowering plant native to the Andean region of Ecuador. It belongs to the family Polygonaceae, which includes plants known for their distinctive leaf shapes and often edible roots. The plant is characterized by its upright, branched stems and small, clustered flowers that bloom in late spring. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, contributing to its unique botanical appearance. Perymenium ecuadoricum is often found in moist, shaded habitats within cloud forests.
